ab.ab: Nērang VVrS24.1 (Nērang ī āb) [mss. 4000, 4010, 4020, 4025, 4063], cf. Revāyat of Kāma Bohra (MU1, pp. 577-578):

pad ān ī ašemwohū sē pad bun ī hōmāst bē nigerišn pas barəsmana bun kunišn bawēd kē šaš gōwēd čahār kē azabar nibišt ud dō kē ō ī pēš gōwēm panzōm ān ī wāz-gīrišnīh ī pad hōmāst sar hamāg xūb nigerišn

"He has to gaze (at them) at the three aṣ̌əm vohū at the beginning of the Hōmāst. Then he has to begin the barəsmana (VVrS25.1). There is one who says: "Six (times). The four times mentioned before and the two that I will mention later. The fith: he has to gaze properly at the Wāz Grišnīh at the end of the Hōmāst (VVrS31.8 or VVrS31.10)"

pad ān ī aṣ̌əm vōhū sē gānag pad bun ī hōmāst pad ān harw aṣ̌əm pādyāb ud pad harw ēk vōhū āb xūb bē nigerišn pas az hād ī hōmāst barəsmana (VVrS25.1) bun kunišn bawēd kē šaš gyāg gōwēd panj kē azabar nibišt dō kē ō pēš gōwam haftōm pad ān ī wāz-gīrišnīh pad hōmāst sar ciyōn pas az aməšāspəṇtā pad gyāg aϑā ratuš pādyāb aṣ̌āt̰.cīt̰ āb be nigērišn

"At the three aṣ̌əm vōhū at the beginning of the Hōmāst, at each aṣ̌əm he has to gaze properly the pādyāb and at each vōhū the water. Afterwards he has to start from the chapter of the Hōmāst beginning with barəsmana (VVrS25.1). There is one who says: "Six (times). The five times mentioned before and the two that I will mention later. The seventh: at the Wāz Grišnīh at the end of the Hōmāst, as it is after aməšāspəṇtā (VVrS28.1) he has to gaze at the pādyāb at aϑā ratuš and at the water at aṣ̌āt̰.cīt̰ (VVrS31.8 or VVrS31.10).
Revāyat of Kāmdin Šapur (var. a) (MU1, pp. 581):

(Pāz.) pa ą̇n si aṣ̌əm vōhū āxərəbą̇m ą̇n jā ki ẏeŋ́he me (VVrS24.2) u haomaną̇m uzdātaną̇m (VVrS24.4) gōiiṇt̰ pa har aṣ̌əm nīrəṇg u pa vōhū āv nigrīδan u pa vāj gīraṣ̌ni buni huməst ki rāspī ẏaϑā ahū vairiō zaotāu zōt̰ pa aϑā ratuš (VVrS24.3) nīraṇg aṣ̌āt̰.cit̰ āv nigarīδan

"At the three aṣ̌əm vōhū at the end of the Bagān, (when) they say ẏeŋ́he me (VVrS24.2) and haomaną̇m uzdātaną̇m (VVrS24.4), he has to look the nēraṇg at each aṣ̌əm and the water at each vōhū and at the Wāz Grišnīh, when the rāspīg (says) ẏaϑā ahū vairiō zaotā (VVrS24.3) and the zōt̰ at aϑā ratuš should look the nēraṇg and at aṣ̌āt̰.cit̰ the water.
Revāyat of Kāmdin Šapur (var. b) (MU1, p.584):
(Pāz.) aṣ̌əm (VVrS24.1) gūmīz vōhū āv sigānah banigaraṣ̌ni pas barəsmana (VVrS25.1) baγubaṣ̌nu guftan
At aṣ̌əm (VVrS24.1) he has to look the gōmēz thrice and at vōhū the water thrice. Then he has to recite barəsmana (VVrS25.1).

(Per.) pas (AvPerTr) ašim vohu (VVrS24.1) se tā bahr-e se (AvPerTr) asim vohu gomiz va āb ḫub benagarešn (AvPerTr) yenghemi (VVrS24.2) tā sar pas rās̱vi begāh sraoṣ̌auuarəzą̇m šodan haomanną̇m. uzdātaną̇m (VVrS24.4) tā vāǧ girišni-e bon-e humast se beguyand gomiz va āb digar ḫub benegarišn pas (AvPerTr)āyatade dam mazešt (VVrS31.1) beḫᵛānešn.

Then three aṣ̌əm vohū and at each of the three aṣ̌əm vohū he has to gaze properly at the gōmēz and the water. Then (he should recite) yeŋ́hē mē (VVrS24.2) to the end and then the rāspīg has to go to the place of the srōšāwarzān (and recite) haōmanąm uzdātanąm. Until the Wāz-Grišnīh at the beginning of the Hōmāst, while reciting, he has to gaze properly thrice the gōmēz and the water. The he should recite aētat̰ dim mazištəm (VVrS31.1).
